questions.questionText: Which of the following is not a keyword in java?
questions.explanation: Boolean is a class and is not a keyword.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is correct about features of JavaScript?

options.text: JavaScript is is complementary to and integrated with HTML.

questions.explanation: enum is not used as a type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: If a bean is scoped to HTTP request, scope is?
questions.explanation: If a bean is scoped to HTTP request, scope is request.

questions.questionText: Which method is used to save or update the state of the given instance from the underlying database?
questions.explanation: Session.saveOrUpdate either saves(Object) or updates(Object) the given instance.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is the correct way to apply a filter?
questions.explanation: filter are applied using pipe character.

options.text: An immutable object is an instance of an abstract class
An immutable object can be changed once it is created.
An immutable object can't be changed once it is created

questions.explanation: An immutable object can't be changed once it is created. String objects are immutable

questions.questionText: Which built-in method removes the last element from an array and returns that element?
questions.explanation: pop() method removes the last element from an array and returns that element.

questions.questionText: Which of the following filter is used to slice a piece of data from the input string.?
questions.explanation: slice filter is used to slice a piece of data from the input string.

questions.questionText: What is the default value of byte variable?
questions.explanation: Byte variable has default value of 0 if defined as an instance/static variable.

questions.questionText: Which are the modules of Data Access/ integration layer?
questions.explanation: jDBC, ORM, OXM, JMS, Transactions are the modules of Data Access/ Integration layer.

questions.questionText: Which of the following function of Number object forces a number to display in exponential notation?
questions.explanation: toExponential(): Forces a number to display in exponential notation, even if the number is in the range in which JavaScript normally uses standard notation.

questions.questionText: Which of the following function of String object returns the calling string value converted to lower case?
questions.explanation: toLowerCase() âˆ’ Returns the calling string value converted to lower case..

questions.questionText: Which of the following configuration element is present in POM.xml?
questions.explanation: Both of the above configuration elements are present in POM.xml.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is the default value of packaging?
questions.explanation: If no packaging value has been specified, it will default to jar.

questions.questionText: Maven Plugins are generally used to:
questions.explanation: Maven plugins are used to do both of the above mentioned tasks.
